alert.note: Alert for Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 6:58AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Georgetown and central Williamsburg Counties through 730 AM EDT... At 658 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Earle, or 19 miles southeast of Kingstree, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Andrews, Lambert, Rhems, Trio, Warsaw, Earle, Nesmith and Morrisville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
